artist: Artist: After Maria Sibylla Merian; Engraver: Pieter Sluyter (Sluiter)
creditline:
The Minnich Collection
The Ethel Morrison Van DerLip Fund, 1966
portfolio: From Metamorphosis Insectorum Surinamensium, first published 1705
text: The butterfly shown resting and in flight is the Morpho menelaus (Linnaeus), a species Merian described as a "…most beautiful butterfly…looking like polished silver overlaid with the loveliest ultramarine, green and purple, and indescribably beautiful; its beauty cannot be rendered with the paint-brush."
title: Blue Butterflies and Foliage
